item.title: MariaDB spinout SkySQL secures seed funding to ‘bring conversational AI to databases’
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Anyone who’s followed the fortunes of MySQL and MariaDB these past 15 years will probably remember SkySQL, another brand that once existed within that same database ecosystem and, a year ago, became a standalone company once more. That company today announced it has raised its first outside funding — a $6.6 million seed round — […]

item.title: OpenAI 2024 event: How to watch new ChatGPT product reveals and demos
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall
item.description:
OpenAI is in the holiday spirit, it seems. The ChatGPT series of reveals, called “12 Days of OpenAI,” will be streamed live at 10 a.m. PT each weekday through December 23. So far, we’ve seen the launch of ChatGPT Pro, OpenAI’s $200 per month subscription plan, the full version of its “reasoning” o1 model, the […]

item.title: Russian government spies targeted Ukraine using tools developed by cybercriminals
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Researchers say a hacking group linked to the FSB used tools developed by a cybercrime group to target Ukraine's Army and Border Guard.

item.title: Bid to revive UK privacy damages suit against Google DeepMind fails to show class
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Another attempt to get a class-action style privacy damages case to stick against Google has failed in the U.K. after the Court of Appeal refused to overturn an earlier dismissal. The lawsuit concerned the misuse of health records for some 1.6 million patients whose information was passed to Google’s AI division, DeepMind, back in 2015 […]

item.title: Apple reportedly developing AI server chip with Broadcom
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Apple is working with semiconductor company Broadcom on its first server chip designed to handle AI applications, according to The Information, which cited three people with knowledge of the project.  Apple is known for designing its own chips – called Apple Silicon and primarily manufactured by TSMC – for its devices. But those chips weren’t […]

item.title: Linux Foundation sets up India entity to boost open source collaboration
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Linux Foundation has launched its India entity to boost open-source contributions from the South Asian nation, the second largest developer base after the U.S.

item.title: Video app Kino, from the maker of Halide, is Apple’s iPhone app of the year
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
ChatGPT may currently be the No. 1 app on the iPhone App Store in the U.S., but it’s not Apple’s iPhone app of the year. That honor goes to a newer app for videographers, called Kino. Launched this spring from Lux, the company behind the professional photography app Halide, Kino advances mobile video recording with […]

item.title: Krispy Kreme discloses cyberattack that is disrupting online orders
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Doughnut multinational Krispy Kreme disclosed a cyberattack that disrupted certain operations, including online ordering in the United States.

item.title: 200 VCs wanted to get into Lumen Orbit’s $11M seed round
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Lumen Orbit, a startup looking to build data centers in space, was able to close its recent seed round in mere days amid intense investor interest. The Redmond, Washington-based company closed on a $11 million seed round at a $40 million valuation, confirming prior TechCrunch reporting that the company had raised a competitive double-digit round […]

item.title: Snapchat users can now keep messages in a chat for a week
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Snapchat is rolling out a few new features for users and Snapchat+ subscribers for the holiday season, the company announced on Wednesday. The features include expanded chat options, new app themes, and more. Snapchat users now have the option to save their conversations for seven days instead of having them disappear after 24 hours. Snap […]

item.title: Gemini 2.0, Google’s newest flagship AI, can generate text, images, and speech
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google’s next major AI model has arrived to combat a slew of new offerings from OpenAI. On Wednesday, Google announced Gemini 2.0 Flash, which the company says can natively generate images and audio in addition to text. 2.0 Flash can also use third-party apps and services, allowing it to tap into Google Search, execute code, […]

item.title: Google unveils Project Mariner: AI agents to use the web for you
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Google unveiled its first-ever AI agent that can take actions on the web on Wednesday, a research prototype from the company’s DeepMind division called Project Mariner. The Gemini-powered agent takes control of your Chrome browser, moves the cursor on your screen, clicks buttons, and fills out forms, allowing it to use and navigate websites much […]

item.title: YC-backed Finny is using AI to match financial advisors with prospects
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Financial advisors have a big hurdle when it comes to finding new clients: Cold outreach rarely works. Often, the only way to find a good prospect is to tap your network for warm intros, or trawl platforms like LinkedIn, Pitchbook or ZoomInfo in hopes of landing a meeting, which may or may not convert. Eden […]

item.title: Reveal Technology raises $11M to scale ‘decision dominance’ tools for DOD
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Military operators need to rapidly make decisions in high-stakes environments, but they’re often stuck with technology that’s unable to deliver accurate information about their surroundings. Military leaders have made clear that they’re prioritizing “decision dominance” for troops, but actually shipping new technologies and getting them in the hands of end users can be more challenging.  […]

The startup has been working to imbue the humble brick with the ability to transform electricity into heat and store it for hours on end.

However, some features were missing from the lineup, like Genmoji, which allows users to create emojis from written prompts.  Now, with iOS 18.2, iPadOS 18.2, and macOS Sequoia 15.2 officially available, the highly anticipated AI-generated Bitmoji […]

item.title: Researchers uncover Chinese spyware used to target Android devices
